Method Detail

orientedAngleBetween2d

public static double orientedAngleBetween2d(Coordinates start,
                                            Coordinates line1End,
                                            Coordinates line2End)
Calculate the counter clockwise angle in radians of the difference between the two vectors from the start point and line1End and line2End. The angle is relative to the vector from start to line1End. The angle will be in the range 0 -> 2 * PI.

Returns:
The angle in radians.

Parameters:

point - The point.

Calculate the distance between the line from x1,y1 to x2,y2 and the point x,y.

Parameters:
x1 - The x coordinate at the start of the line.
y1 - The y coordinate at the start of the line.
x2 - The x coordinate at the end of the line.
y2 - The y coordinate at the end of the line.
x - The x coordinate of the point.
y - The y coordinate of the point.
Returns:
The distance.

Check to see if the point (x,y) intersects the envelope of the line from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2).

Parameters:
x1 - The x coordinate at the start of the line.
y1 - The y coordinate at the start of the line.
x2 - The x coordinate at the end of the line.
y2 - The y coordinate at the end of the line.
x - The x coordinate of the point.
y - The y coordinate of the point.
Returns:
True if the point intersects the line's envelope.

envelopeIntersects

public static boolean envelopeIntersects(Coordinates line1Start,
                                         Coordinates line1End,
                                         Coordinates line2Start,
                                         Coordinates line2End)
Check to see if the envelope one the line from line1Start to line1End intersects the envelope of the line from line2Start to line2End.

Parameters:
line1Start - The point at the start of the first line.
line1End - The point at the end of the first line.
line2Start - The point at the start of the second line.
line2End - The point at the end of the second line.
Returns:
True if the envelope of line intersects the envelope of line 2.

intersection

public static List<Coordinates> intersection(CoordinatesPrecisionModel precisionModel,
                                             Coordinates line1Start,
                                             Coordinates line1End,
                                             Coordinates line2Start,
                                             Coordinates line2End)
Get the intersection between line (segment) 1 and line (segment) 2. The result will be either and empty collection, a single coordinates value for a crosses intersection or a pair of coordinates for a linear intersection. The results will be rounded according to the precision model. Any z-value interpolation will be calculated using the z-values from line (segment) 1.

Parameters:
precisionModel -
line1Start -
line1End -
line2Start -
line2End -
Returns:

isPointOnLine

public static boolean isPointOnLine(CoordinatesPrecisionModel precisionModel,
                                    Coordinates lineStart,
                                    Coordinates lineEnd,
                                    Coordinates point)
Check to see if the point is on the line between lineStart and lineEnd using the precision model to see if a line split at the projection of the point on the line would be the same point.

Parameters:
precisionModel - The precision model.
lineStart - The point at the start of the line.
lineEnd - The point at the end of the line.
point - The point.
Returns:
True if the point is on the line.

projectionFactor

public static double projectionFactor(Coordinates lineStart,
                                      Coordinates lineEnd,
                                      Coordinates point)
Calculate the projection factor of the distance of the point coordinates along the line. If the point is within the line the range will be between 0.0 -> 1.0.

Parameters:
lineStart - The start coordinates of the line.
lineEnd - The end coordinates of the line.
point - The point coordinates.
Returns:
The projection factor from (-inf -> +inf).

projectionFactor

public static double projectionFactor(double x1,
                                      double y1,
                                      double x2,
                                      double y2,
                                      double x,
                                      double y)
Calculate the projection factor of the distance of the point (x,y) coordinates along the line (x1,y1 -> x2,y2). If the point is within the line the range will be between 0.0 -> 1.0.

Parameters:
x1 - The x coordinate for the start of the line.
y1 - The y coordinate for the start of the line.
x2 - The x coordinate for the end of the line.
y2 - The y coordinate for the end of the line.
x - The x coordinate for the point.
y - The y coordinate for the point.
Returns:
The projection factor from (-inf -> +inf).

                              Coordinates lineEnd,
                              Coordinates point)
